author: gpetruc
body:
As presented in https://indico.cern.ch/event/747970/ plus a minor fix on isolated photons (a loose cut on the solid-cone tracker isolation, since for collimated fakes the hollow-cone may miss the hadron; that was in the results shown, but not described in the slides), and a tightening of the electron id from veto to medium as suggested by EGamma, all rebased to `CMSSW_10_3_X`


* All features are controlled by both the HCal channel quality DB object and configuration switches, off by default. A cmsDriver era `pf_badHcalMitigation` turns the features on

Two other features are logically part of this PR but for practical purposes were integrated in a separate request #24320:
* The information about invalid H/E in reco::Photon and reco::GsfElectron objects is saved in a new flag added to the shower shape structure. The filling of the flag is enabled by default independently of the era. When reading objects reconstructed with an earlier release, the flag defaults to valid H/E.
* For the implementation of the PFCluster status flag for the clusters used to mark masked Hcal areas. 

The code is in principle agnostic of the kind of Hcal failure, but was tested only for HEM 15-16.
title: Code for PF HEM 15-16 mitigation
